name: NPR
text:
Almost 300,000 nursing home residents are given antipsychotic drugs each weekâ€”despite most having no psychosis to justify it.

And under the Trump administration, nursing homes have rarely paid a price for even the most serious misuses, a new report finds.

text:
With much of the Navajo Nation stuck at home due to the pandemic, one Navajo farmer is on a mission to help people return to their roots by teaching traditional farming techniques.

text: The Remington Arms Company, which has been making guns in the U.S. since 1816, filed for bankruptcy protection amid ongoing legal and financial challenges. https://t.co/QLV1tFd0LJ

name: NPR
text:
We've come to expect legal waivers for things like skiing or bungee-jumping.

But now colleges and businesses â€” from hair salons to dentists' offices â€” are using them to try to shield themselves from liability as they reopen during the pandemic.

name: NPR
text: An Australian pub has banned two emus, siblings Kevin and Carol, after they learned to climb the pub steps and created havoc inside â€” stealing food from customers and loitering behind the bar. https://t.co/wWZhykx7PP
